content.text: An activity-based adventure for daydreamers and doers
Meander your way through Wanderland to explore mind-wandering, day-dreaming and doodling.

When does your mind wander, and where does it go? Despite their negative reputation, might boredom, mind-wandering and doodling benefit us? Using creative cues to spark your imagination, let your mind roam in Wanderland while you explore, draw, make and do.
This installation has been created and curated by a group of young people from RawMinds, Wellcome Collection’s creative programme for 14-to-19-year-olds, working with artist Joceline Howe.

The group were inspired by the work of Hubbub, a Wellcome-funded interdisciplinary group of researchers, scientists and artists who have spent two years investigating the theme of rest and its opposites.
If you would like to explore this theme further, you can visit hubbub’s free exhibition, ‘Rest and its discontents’, at The Mile End Pavilion, 30 September-30 October.
Meander your way around Wanderland, responding to creative cues to explore how our minds wander.
